Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of NeuroPort™ Microelectrode Array in Epilepsy Monitoring

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, seven patients undergoing subdural electrode implantation for epilepsy monitoring were included.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility required the need for epilepsy monitoring, and participants were implanted with the NeuroPort™ MEA in putative non-eloquent epileptogenic cortex.

Intervention.evidence: participants were implanted with the NeuroPort™ MEA in putative non-eloquent epileptogenic cortex.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the successful recording of LFPs and single-unit activity over 3–28 days.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: seven patients undergoing subdural electrode implantation for epilepsy monitoring were included.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Successful MEA implantation was achieved in all patients with minor operative difficulties.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Robust and durable LFPs and single-unit recordings were obtained from all individuals.

Harms.evidence: Two patients developed post-resection wound healing issues at the site of scalp egress, with one requiring operative wound revision.
